intro: Tarchonanthus dentatus, commonly known as the African daisy, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its showy, daisy-like flowers that bloom in shades of yellow and orange. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are usually narrow and slightly toothed, giving it the species name "dentatus." Tarchonanthus dentatus is adapted to arid environments and is often found in savannas and rocky areas.
